alert.note: Alert for Jones (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 9:52PM CDT until June 04 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas for Abilene, including the following counties, Jones and Taylor. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 950 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms over Abilene. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Abilene, Dyess Afb, Impact, Kirby Lake and Lake Fort Phantom Hill. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 279 and 292. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Curry Lane from Clack Street to Catclaw Drive, Intersections along Buttonwillow Parkway, Intersections along Sammons Street, Texas Avenue at Arnold Boulevard, Butternut Underpass, Broken Bough At Chimney Rock, FM 3308 crossing Draw, South 27th Street at Catclaw Creek, Antilley Rd. crossing Button Willow Creek and South 20th Street and Brentwood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
